home.title: Weather Model Accuracy Comparison
home.subtitle: Compare weather forecast accuracy for your favorite flying sites

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.subtitle: How we measure forecast accuracy
methodology.howItWorksDesc: Meteo Score objectively evaluates weather forecast model accuracy by comparing forecast predictions against real-world observations from weather beacons and stations. This helps paragliding pilots and outdoor enthusiasts understand which forecasts are most reliable for their specific flying sites.
methodology.maeDesc: MAE measures the average magnitude of forecast errors. Lower is better. For example, an MAE of 4.2 km/h for wind speed means the model is typically off by approximately 4.2 km/h in either direction.
methodology.positiveBiasDesc: Model systematically overestimates (e.g., predicts stronger wind than actually observed)
methodology.negativeBiasDesc: Model systematically underestimates (e.g., predicts weaker wind than actually observed)
methodology.zeroBiasDesc: No systematic tendency - errors are random
methodology.aromeDesc: AROME - Météo-France high-resolution numerical weather model (2.5km grid resolution, updated 4x daily)
methodology.meteoParapenteDesc: Meteo-Parapente - Specialized forecast service optimized for paragliding conditions
methodology.rommaDesc: ROMMA - Network of automated mountain weather beacons providing real-time observations
methodology.ffvlDesc: FFVL - French Free Flight Federation weather stations at popular flying sites
methodology.dataCollectionStep1: Forecasts are retrieved 4 times daily (00h, 06h, 12h, 18h UTC model runs)
methodology.dataCollectionStep2: Observations are collected 6 times daily from beacon networks
methodology.dataCollectionStep3: Forecasts are matched with observations within a 30-minute window
methodology.dataCollectionStep4: Deviation is calculated: Forecast Value - Observed Value
methodology.dataCollectionStep5: Aggregate metrics (MAE, Bias) are computed from 90+ days of historical deviations
methodology.confidenceLevelsDesc: The reliability of our metrics depends on how much historical data is available for each site:
methodology.preliminaryDesc: Results will stabilize with more data
methodology.insufficientDesc: Not enough data for reliable conclusions
methodology.limitationPastPerfDesc: Metrics reflect historical accuracy and do not guarantee future forecast quality
methodology.limitationSiteSpecificDesc: Results at one location may not apply to nearby sites with different terrain or microclimate
methodology.limitationExtremeEventsDesc: Rare weather events may not be well-represented in the statistics
methodology.limitationMeasurementDesc: Observation beacons have their own measurement errors (typically ±0.5 km/h for wind, ±0.3°C for temperature)
methodology.transparencyDesc: Meteo Score is fully open source. All code, methodology, and data processing logic are publicly available for review and verification:
methodology.questionsDesc: We welcome questions, suggestions, and bug reports. Please open an issue on
methodology.orContactMaintainers: or reach out to the maintainers.
